intro: Stahlia monosperma, commonly known as the single-seeded stahlia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a single seed per fruit, which is a unique feature among its relatives. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a slightly hairy texture. Stahlia monosperma is often found in cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
